ovdesc.p: FATCA.FORM.TYPE will be used to record the valid documents that will be accepted by the bank for ensuring FATCA compliance. Only the documents specified here can be specified in FORM TYPE field of FATCA CUSTOMER SUPPLEMENTARY INFO

desc.p: Contains the description of the document to which the record pertains
Validation rules
1-50 Free format description
The field is used to specify whether these documents are allowed only for entities For example,
EIN, ANNUAL OWNER CONFIRMATION, etc.
Validation rules
Yes or No
The ID can either be the actual form or document reference (W9, W8BEN) or a code to identify the document, the details of which are specified in the DESCRIPTION field.
Validation rules
1-35 Free format document reference (alphanumeric)
Identifies any additional element which has been defined locally to meet a particular requirement.

As in the majority of T24 Applications, the User is allowed to define in the up to 999 Local elements in addition to the standard fields previously specified. These local elements should be defined by the User where deemed necessary according to local practice.
The name of the new element(s), as well as the Format and Validation Rules, must be defined in the Local Tables and Local.Ref.Table prior to their use in the FATCA.PARAMETER application .
Validation Rules

Up to 35 characters as defined in the Local Table definition for this local reference field. Multi-value field. (Optional or Mandatory input according to definition in Local Table for this Local Reference element.)
As defined by the User within the individual Local Table
The field will be set to YES if the document establishes the NON-US status (for example, W8). If US DOCUMENT is set as YES, this cannot be set as YES and vice versa.
Validation rules
Yes or No
This field can only be set to Yes if the field US.DOCUMENT is not set to Yes
This field is reserved for future use.
This field is reserved for future use.
This field is reserved for future use.
The field will be set to YES if the document establishes the US status (for example, W9).
Validation rules

p.p: Cannot be Yes if NON.US.DOCUMENT field value is set as Yes.
